column4: My mute button isn't muting.  It shows the mute symbol or the unmute symbol, but doesn't actually mute.  Any ideas?
mine doesn't mute either.. just sets the volume really low
I would put 2 GB or so
not even sure you
yes
symbolic links might work nicely.. ln is the command
man ln for more info
I tried ln -s with nothing, but I wasn't sure if it was just me, so long as you think it'll work, I'll keep looking.
man ln ... read it, there are parameters

I've been google-ing, and reading the man pages, I can't seem to get that working.  I did "ln -s TARGET" as the manpage has for the second form, to link TARGET to the current directory, and it isn't working.
you want the first form.. ln TARGET LINK_NAME
so to make a link to another folder you'd use ln -s thelinkname /some/other/folder/or/file
you're welcome
I'm pretty sure that you've got it wrong
don't symlinks always need a base copy of the file? but hard links just remain until the last hard link is removed?
I would say hard links make more sense unless there is an obvious way of knowing where the original file is located
Yes, but hard links duplicate size.  I'd want to keep the same locations, just only use 1 bit of space.
sure about that?
I don't mean "1 bit" i mean one 1x space not 2x or 3x.
hard links duplicat size, are you sure?
Pretty sure
Although google-ing is giving me mixed answers
No big deal, I found a selection thing, I don;t need the duplicates, so I deleted them.  Thanks though.
you're welcome
